1.label: Delayed OFF time
1.description: The configuration value is a signed single byte number. This value may represent a value with no units or may represent a value such as time. 0 to 127 (decimal) represents 0 to 127 seconds of time. -128 to -1 (negative decimal numbers) represents 128 to 255 seconds as calculated by this formula.  Config value = desired time in seconds (or desired value) -256 For an example of 172 seconds: config value = 172 - 256 = -84 (decimal) or 0xAC (hex)

4.label: Basic set value
4.description: Setting this to anything other than 0 will cause the value to be transmitted to devices in the association group when the switch is triggered. A setting other than 0 will likely result in undesired operation

5.label: Power Up State
5.description: Power up state of the device

6.label: Panic mode enable
6.description: Enables this switch to participate in panic mode

7.label: Dimmer Ramp Time
7.description: The amount of time in seconds the switch will take to reach the desired dim level.  The configuration value is a signed single byte number. This value may represent a value with no units or may represent a value such as time. 0 to 127 (decimal) represents 0 to 127 seconds of time. -128 to -1 (negative decimal numbers) represents 128 to 255 seconds as calculated by this formula.  Config value = desired time in seconds (or desired value) -256 For an example of 172 seconds: config value = 172 - 256 = -84 (decimal) or 0xAC (hex)
